This app is wonderful. I highly recommend.

The only issue I have is that some of my lessons have glitches in them where I cannot fully type the sentence or phrase in the word bar. This causes the app to tell me I have gotten the wrong answer. When this happens it tells me I am out of hearts and I cannot keep continuing with the lesson, which really interferes with me being able to learn unfortunately. Hopefully they can fix this error because the app would be a five star rating without simple glitches.
I actually learned a language from this app! Also it’s free and when you run outOf hearts you can refill them for free

Other than squandering user learning time, what is the point of the increasing number of useless info screens between lessons? The amount of unnecessary animation is a also waste of time and a distraction, and also seems to increase with each update. In the same vain, if I cared about leagues I would go to that view. Stop wasting my time popping leagues up unbidden between lessons. I hate all the tricks to control when and how users practice. I have speaking lessons turned off, yet stories can no longer be completed without speaking lessons. PRIVACY WARNING: Users be sure and check out how you’re tracked. Now that they have to disclose, you can see that DuoLingo checks nearly every box for NOT respecting user privacy.

*Unless you upgrade you only have 5 mistakes. This is ridiculous as making mistakes is how we learn.*the lessons are too long: too many questions and too many long questions. * the characters are distracting, you can’t get rid of them, you can only stop them from moving. However, you have to log into make that happen.* the app doesn’t really teach anything, the sentences are just nonsense ones that aren’t important when learning a language. There really isn’t much about learning the basics and how to have basic conversations. This app does nothing to teach you anything useful, it’s just nonsense sentences. * the creators care more about the appearance of the app over the quality of the app. If they put effort into the quality of the app, it has the potential to be a decent app, but they don’t care.* the customer service is awful.I don’t recommend Duo, there are better apps to use instead.

It’s a great app overall, it’s easy to comprehend and learn new languages. I will admit, however, that there are certain things that frustrate and discourage me. It’s mostly just placement of words, like “do you want to take the train or the subway?” It has to be in that exact order. Another thing is lives. I’m completely okay with the five lives, but I don’t think lives should be taken away if you are still learning the words (haven’t collected a crown for that lesson.) Just keep these things into account when you down Duolingo. Like I said, it’s not bad, just frustrating at times.

I sincerely love this app for all of the resources that it offers in language learning, both in the app and through the website. My husband and I have been regular users for the past 3 years. We’ve tried other popular learning apps, subscription based and free, but kept coming back to Duolingo since it’s so fun and easy to use. Language learning is something that’s important to the both of us so paying for the monthly/yearly subscription doesn’t bother us. What has been annoying is recently is what I call the “pay to play” features. It started with the Lightning round feature, which was fun at first (testing your knowledge against time), but has become increasingly dependent on “timer boosts” which you have the “option” to buy. Now they have changed it so that you have to share your progress outside the app, to get lingots. They’ve also now been pushing for you to use lingots more often (to get extra XP during a hard course, to get the double XP boost after completing the weekly review, etc) and you can also buy more lingots. I understand that the creators need to make money in order to make these language learning features available and I understand that running an app takes up a lot of time and resources. I am also someone who believes that people should be compensated for putting in their time and effort into keeping the app running. However, These additional pay- features are starting to feel more like traditional corporate greed rather than being to better the app experience. One of my goals in life is to be able to speak 5 languages, Duolingo makes me feel like I can accomplish this. I still enjoy using the app but  it would really be a shame to see Duolingo fall into the usual trap of increasing profit margins at the expense of their users.

The only time I could remember hearing it used in the English language was Elvis Presley’s “Viva Las Vegas” or a brand of paper towels. This app is great. I’ve been using it for years to take continuing education courses in design at UCLAs extension program. I love being able to take classes on the go as a professional. I can watch lectures during breaks at work, at the park, on the bus, in a cab, on a plane, or at midnight. That paired with text books in an e-reader platform like Kindle is a game changer for learning.However, I would encourage the developers to consider developing TV Apps for the modern student. As a design student, I like to sit on the couch with my laptop or iPad an work in my design apps while watching the lecture on a 64” TV which is awesome. As a professional, class time is my ‘relax’ time so sitting on a couch after finally stepping away from my home office desk at night is important. If I’m working on my laptop I can project on the screen as a second monitor but sometimes I don’t need my laptop and leave the heavy thing at work. If I mirror from my phone then every time I pause the lecture video to do something, the projection stop from my phone. It’s also far better to watch boring lectures from the TV than hunched over a desk too!Also, we please make an immersive reader that works within the app. At the end of the day my eyes are tired and dyslexia kicks in hard. The immersive reader when signed into a internet browser on canvas is great but I cannot see important design images from lecture. Yet again, I often project written lectures onto my TV with my iPhone so I can see images and use the immersive reader on my iPad through the internet platform of Canvas. It would be great if the immersive reader worked within the app and/or allowed images uploaded by the professor.Thank you and keep it up.

I would give zero stars if Apple allowed me to do so.  Let me start by saying I do not want to use this software in the first place. I don’t need to know the minutiae of my kids’ day at school. Where I get extremely frustrated is the constant nagging for me to buy a subscription to premium content when I don’t even want the free content. I find this app beyond obnoxious and would love for educators to focus on teaching rather than updating unnecessary software. I lovED using OneNote when it was part of the OFFICE Home and Student desktop software, when almost no one even used it bc they didn’t know what it was. The feature that I liked the most is now gone... THE COLORED TABS ON THE TOP (I’m not yelling) . Now it is just like other apps like IOS Notes or Evernote. The tabs on the top and pages on the side made OneNote very unique and easy to navigate. It made it really work like a binder or real notebook with dividers. Now, from when they released the free app version all that was gone, and little by little they started to add what they call “new features” (excuse me, but LOL), when they are not new. They existed back then, from the beginning, when you could even choose what to show in the toolbar... You could customize the tool bar! :) I still have stored notes from OneNote2003, 2007, 2010, 2013... (You can read about all its versions in Wikipedia). Why instead of reinvent the old concept they don’t just add the real new features of this Internet Era? I’m just waiting for the day that they say “Try the new idea, the wow new concept that we just thought you will love: Tabs on the top with color for each one, named sections, with their own pages on the side, each one automatically sized and aligned to the left, and our very good workable search engine; plus automatically synchronized with the cloud version... And if you lose notes you can find them in the Deleted Notes Folder.... etc” That day... I hope comes soon. The new App creators only need to go to the archives to rescue those features that the old makers worked on and realized that their new inventions are not new.UPDATE 2/17/2022: I realized  few months after my above review, that the features that I mentioned that OneNote is missing or that have changed, especially the TABS ON TOP, still exist in the desktop version, aka “One Note 2010, 2013”, etc.  I feel bad for my comments to MS developers, whose I noticed today when reading other reviews, that anyway they don’t reply to reviewers. Otherwise they would had told me of my “mistake”.  I’m happy that at least still they have most of those features in the desktop version, that by the way I was able to put in my devices as an app, installing it as OneNote Desktop. Anyways, it would be awesome that they integrate them in the regular OneNote app, beginning by giving the user the option of putting the tabs and tab groups on top, OR in the side as a column by the pages column.

I’ve used OneNote to take notes in school for several years now, but this recent update has made the experience mildly infuriating. For starters, the button for undo is right next to the button to view all of your notebooks and they are both arrows pointing leftish, so I keep pushing the wrong one. It’s not ideal placement or design. Second, this recent update has made the app very glitchy. Strokes of my pencil will disappear frequently after I write them and to fix it, I have to restart the app. This issue comes up multiple times a day. The app often confuses my hand and the pen so the page will abruptly zoom in or out or move over several inches while I’m writing something. The insert space feature now inserts a massive blank space by default and I can’t control how wide the space is many times now. Overall, disappointing update. I’m definitely considering moving to a different note taking app. The only reason I am continuing to use OneNote at this point is that it’s very tedious or impossible to migrate notes from one note taking app to another. Please fix all the glitches!!Oh and also, trying to export to PDF is a nightmare unless your notes are exactly the right width. It will try and export by cutting the notes into a grid, so when you export and print your left with a useless pile of papers that are completely impractical. Please give the option to fit to page width when you export, it would save me sooo much trouble and distress
Easy to use, logical breakdown for organizing workflow, SOPs and definitions for collaborative teams.

This has been the answer to all my prayers on what a note taking app can be. They have the best approach to making note easily accessible wherever you are. There’s only two things I’d suggest to make this the best note taking app ever. The first is supporting multiple windows, I love doing homework with my notes right next to me. The second is to not be connected to the internet all the time. Google docs does a good job of saving every chance it gets but not slowing you down with lag when the connection slows down and freaking out if it’s not synced. Other than that best app by far and I’m using the free version. Definitely recommend.

content: I love this game! It has so many fun mini games and it’s goofy at ever turn.However, there seems to be a number of bugs that have not been fixed which is why I’m only giving this game 3-stars.1. The marshmallow in the marshmallow roasting mini-game is not rendered, and there only is a fuzzy shape of the marshmallow.2. A bug from the yeti-grooming mini game appears in the ice-skating mini game at the end when won.3. Sometimes, the tasks done to get the ticket don’t always result in getting the ticket. For instance, when prompted to visit the merch store to redeem a ticket, it would not allow me to redeem it after visiting the merch store.4. There is no sound when one taps on a character they have unlocked.Other than these issues I really do love this game! Please fix them; the game experience will be  greatly improved!
app_name: Dumb Ways to Die 2: The Games

The extensive use of colors in the initial fit test made this app unusable for me. I am green/red colorblind which is very common. You would think they could come up with a more friendly palette as so many other apps have.

I like Lumosity. I usually play it in the mornings to get my brain working. I’m 58 years old and trying to keep brain young.However, there are two games that I think could use tweaking. Word snatchers game uses words that I think are not used much today so it’s very hard to try to come up with them just by the description. And I would appreciate if there were another way to play the math game where it drops  the equations and you have to solve them before they hit the bottom. Math is hard for me and I have a hard time trying to think up the answer fast enough. I do like it as I know it has improved my skills but would be nice to be able to slow it down and think it through.

I pay for the premium subscription and love it. I really like watching my scores for each category improve over time. I just wish they would release new games every once in a while. I’m on a 560 day streak and have played all of the available games so many times that I’m starting to lose interest. The Feel the Beat game has been in “early access” for at least two years. My subscription will be up for renewal soon and I’m probably not going to renew it.

It's great to challenge your brain and I love brain exercises. Just like the rest of our body, our brain needs to exercise too. While I recommend  Lumosity to my clients to exercise their brain. UPDATE TO THE REVIEW I WROTE 7 YEARS AGOWhile Lumosity was fun, I now find it boring.  I enjoyed it so much that I went a paid for a lifetime subscription. I think it was something like $250. This program is light years above some of the brain games we have seen in the past.  I find it’s challenges are perfectly “where I’m at”.   It’s stimulating, as I want to play it much longer than necessary each day.  The games are easy to figure out for someone on the spectrum. Or I found them to be there’s a lot of different things they challenge you on that I believe will really help me to get my mind in shape so I can return to a PhD program soon.  My mind does feel “worked out” but not tired.     The yearly fee is around 40$ and from what I can see it’s well worth it.  I plan to purchase it. I’m about halfway through the free trial now. I would recommend it to anyone really.

The underlying algorithms keep changing the outcomes based on your actions, without disclosure. That is disappointing and keeps you addicted to wanting to score better. So however well you perform you will get screwed at the highest levels, leaving you unfulfilled.  Your actions will always leave you unsatisfied and wanting to try more. The magic of keeping one hooked. To this reviewer, modulating outcomes midway  based on your actions is undesirable. Try out some of the games, let them run without inputs, and the scores are different every time, even though ones actions were a naught. Alternatively, take random fast actions, and you will score high.  Knowingly playing hidden games with on my brain makes me squirm, unless I knowingly submit to it.  My recommendation is a 60% value.

I purchased this app a while back and it was on auto renew every year. I stopped for a while and when I tried to use it again it asked me for log in. Tried to log in, it would not recognize me and kept sending me to the loop of free trial again, which meant after the 2 weeks it will charge me for a new membership again. There is no direct contact to customer service. There is an email on their web site. emailed them, sent a copy of my apple receipt, they responded (thankfully) a day later to tell me they can't find my email. Tried to explain that I was a member before they had this log on nonsense. sent them a copy again .. no response and if they "can't find my email" no luck?!!! Terrible customer service - absent! Now I am stuck with a year's worth of membership which I can't use. I have had many apps over the years and every app has that option of "restore purchase" without any aggravation. Now I will have to file a complaint with apple and if that won't do it, I will certainly report them to the better business bureau. The 2 stars is for the only game I like for attention, but can certainly find similar ones in other apps. Don't buy a yearly membership.. Actually, if a business is that awful with customer service, stay away! Now I see reviews 2 years back same problem with others, one person had Apple refund only one month of the years subscription. That person had the same Lumosity agent respond the same way I experienced, James. No interest in resolving the issue whatsoever! So it is not a glitch, it's what they are accustomed to dealing with premium subscribers for ongoing ripoff! "can't find my email" really??? shame on them and apple needs to watch out for apps that conduct business that way.

So, I’ve been paying for this service for years.  I put up with being harassed for reviews.  I put up with be constantly coerced to do what *they* wanted me to do. I was a Grand Master at some games.  A Legend for years at another.  I constantly scored at the 99th and 100th percentile.  I logged in today and was told that I was close to leveling up.  At the game that I’ve been a Legend at for years.   I threw the app away and relaunched.  Three times.  Same result.  I restarted the phone and relaunched the app.  Same result. Bye.  If you can’t do something as simple as keeping score, what else can’t you do?   I don’t want to know.  And I’m not paying you for the privilege.  From a business perspective, you’re morons.

I took the plunge and signed up for the paid version and almost immediately it started forcing me to watch ads to get to the next game or, of course,Sign up for a full year and pay even more money. Good luck with that business model.
New ads are interfering with the games and causing me to restart the app.

I’ve had the paid version for several years now and it’s my go-to to kill time, but with as much as I use it, I definitely encounter flaws. Objectifind- I can tap on the correct object 2-3x before it registers, meanwhile, if tapping something much smaller than the rest, it registers my tap on the wrong object.  Just seems like it’s triggered to work against you. Word Fresh- why doesn’t it allow nouns? Word Hunt-1.  Why can’t I highlight a word starting from the last letter?  2.  Why does the tip tell you to swipe as fast as you can once you find a word but when you do, the highlight exceeds the word and won’t register the word until you back track your finger. 3.  Why aren’t there more than 20 categories?! There should be hundreds. This is a paid game afterall.  (Same complaint for Slider, there should be more than just 10 game boards.)Grow - there are some letter combos that even jeopardy geniuses wouldn’t be able to get 3 or 4 words from, let alone your average or above average person. Word path- sometimes when bringing a tile back to the pile, it freezes on the game board. You can then put it back again, but now it doesn’t register any valid words made and the game has to be restarted. Flight Path & Speed Spotter (and others)- not fair to score based on how many of something that’s supplied to score.  For example- flight path- if I end up with 5 letters and 3 of them are the same letter, and the other two are random letters like q,x,z what the heck am I supposed to do with that?  Crash it and wait for more letters to be released one at a time?  That wastes the timer, ultimately affecting the score. Same with the Speed Spotter I can only spot as many “bad guys” as the game provides. I’m often waiting with a full supply of balls and no bad guys. Then the game ends and my score suffers.  These examples are things that shouldn’t impact my brain score as I am at the mercy of the app. Connect ‘Em Up is just stupid.  Same with Decoder. Turtle Traffic- sometimes the only option is to jump over something and there’s NO WAY to avoid hitting something that is placed too close. It’s set up to ding you.  I have completed several surveys when prompted but not sure what good they do as they do not allow for any written feedback, so how do you know what needs to be changed?Would love if at the end of games it showed consistent summaries (All results, not just how many words OR longest word, etc.  Tell me all of it, each time. Would also love the option to ply against other players. Same game boards for each, see who does better.  Also would like to see a global score board.

I paid the money for unlimited games and it is so worth it! Love that I can pick and choose games easily using the Games. I’d really love to be able to go back and review a game when I am having difficulty...is there a way to show an instant replay? Sometimes I simply don’t understand why I was marked wrong and would like to see it. (Example...spin cycle) Some of the games that are supposedly for memory are not, they really call for staring at the screen until it disappears and recreating what your retina shows you. This is not really memory. (Examples...Perilous Path, Memory Sweep, Bounce, Tracker). And finally, some games would benefit from some randomizing. In Connect Em Up it would be nice to play second sometimes. And in Flight Path, it would be nice to have the bonus color on the upper left hand sometimes, rather than always on the right.

Peak is an amazing value. The app is polished and the overall experienced feels new and fresh. There are large variety of games but you have to progress to unlock them all. The games are interesting, and they test a variety of brain skills. compared to other brain training services, Peak offers more than just logic and math or time management. One game trains your perspective and you have to adjust a 3D camera. Another trains emotional intelligence by having you pick faces of people based on their expression. Another you have to select positive words that appear. There are many others. I have tried other brain training apps and for the subscription fee, Peak is hands down a top choice.
After a days work @my office, this relaxes and challenges me at the same time.

The game will be harder if the directions aren’t clear. I’m scoring under my age group. But I just tried Luminosity and I’m at the high end of my age group. Guess who I like better? I’ll be cancelling Peak as soon as I try a few other apps.

Great games that are challenging, unique, fresh and seemingly always more being made. I like how it lets you know how you measure to others at the rank you are at, shows your progress yearly, monthly, weekly, daily and how you have measured during the game session if you replay, which creates a personal challenge to beat your previous scores, increasing the targeted brain/neuro skill. A major bonus is that there are some games developed by doctoral level researchers that help further develop data, that give you access to their published literature and research articles, to learn even more. This app has a free trial, and you will want to continue. Caveat is that it is pretty much unplayable once you have to watch horrible game ads every time you do something; the ones that last forever and you can’t exit out of, probably with some sort of king or person standing in the rain which a pointing arrow that nearly drives someone insane.

I paid for a full year of Peak and now, having played for a month or so, I’m not sure I’ll bother continuing with it. The wide variety of games is impressive at first, but most are minor variations of the same idea. There are four or five versions of the Stroop color word test, a handful of word games, and then some clones of other common mobile puzzle games like Flappy Bird and Picross. With many of the games, I couldn’t tell what was being tested or challenged - many are simply tedious or poorly laid out, so the challenge is dealing with the UI. There is no info in the app explaining exactly what is being tested with each game, and the only metric of personal growth is their “Peak IQ” score

It probably goes without saying that this app isn't 100% accurate identifying plants. That would be pretty awesome. However, when you do see a mistake you can send info about what happened. You can also inspect the pictures and vote if it's the right id or not.  It's an ai using a database that gets built by users. So the more people use it the better it will get. I've already seen improvements in the time I've used it. That said, if it's a rare or confusing plant to identify it might still need more data. One example in my area is mesquite trees. It id's them all as velvet mesquite. We actually have a bunch of kinds depending where you are. I'm so close to the Mexican border we get a lot of plants not considered in the books to be in the USA. Birds and animals too. Nothing is perfect but this app is good to very good and improving every day. As far as common plants it has no trouble usually.

I’ve had other plant apps that give you a selection of the most likely plants, which is a much better model so you can narrow down your search more, as likely one of the potential IDs is correct to some taxon even if not species. I have been using stash for about 2 years now, the best part about it is the early pay and stock back rewards in my opinion. These days there are many “get paid early” apps and banks but, that is not Stash’s only benefit. You can also do investing through them as well, if you are beginner stashes simple buy/sell and weekly repeat investing style is rather good for you. If you are more advanced (options, stop loss, limit orders) then stash might not be for you. You do have the ability to have a brokerage and retirement accounts, they also have a smart portfolio in which they invest for you. Downsides is how long it takes for the sales to happen and you don’t really get to fully control the balancing with sector rotation in the markets. I sort of look at the smart portfolio as a better interest rate savings account of sorts. Stash doesn’t charge any overdraft fees or returned item fees either, they just decline the purchase and be done with it.

This online based brokerage/savings hybrid has its perks. By using the STASH debit card, consumers can earn fractional shares of a stock (limited list to chose from) as “cash back” with each purchase. It offers early direct deposit, making funds available 1-2 days earlier. And there’s a feature to “Lock” the card when not in use. But this Green Dot financial product has its downsides. There’s a monthly fee for service that can’t be waived. Some retailers recognize it as a prepaid gift card and the transaction will get declined. It is a Green Dot Visa debit card so it comes with notoriously horrific customers service. It’s scary that there is zero fraud protection and it’s impossible to reach a human being. I’ve had numerous recurring charges, in small amounts, by unknown merchants, and STASH offers zero fraud protection. I have never gotten my money back from STASH and there is no built-in fraud resolution system. Additionally, if you file a fraud complaint, take out the cash you need first. STASH will deactivate your card the moment you file a fraud complaint. You will not be able to access your account until your new card is activated 2 weeks later. Additionally, this is a terrible way to purchase shares of stock. Buy/Sell Quotes and Transactions don’t execute in real time during market hours but rather random “STASH trading cycles”. There’s no way to choose to buy/sell as a Market or Limit order. And if you sell holdings, it takes between 3 to 8 business days (possibly up to 90 days) before it can be withdrawn as cash. The customer service is terrible. There’s no fraud protection. And it cannot be used like a traditional checking account or a brokerage account. It’s best for individuals whom want to use their debit cards to earn pennies and are perfectly fine with risking losing the rest of the money in their accounts.

You won’t spend your time trying to translate because you will be thinking in your new language.

It’s making me have to do the lesson over to get 100%, so I have to do it enough times to “memorize” which one is the girl. Other than that I love it so far.

I know a little bit a Latin, so it’s easier for me to cover the basics of other languages. My friend speaks Latin-American Spanish. She is having difficulties with her English. I thought I would learn Spanish to help her with her English. I have tried multiple language-learning platforms, and this is the best one yet! It allows me to mess up without feeling bad but also gives me plenty of room to grow. I would recommend the “travel” course. Once you learn the Spanish roots, you can learn full words. For example: in English, if a word is plural, you just add an “s”. However, in Spanish, you change the whole sentence. I would have never learned this if it weren’t for Rosetta Stone!!

I constantly receive messages about the lack of the internet (which is working fine, as evidenced by me sending this review), which brings the lessons to a grinding halt. I also often receive messages about poor quality of sound from my microphone, regardless if I use the built-in microphone (on the latest iPad Air) or AirPods. All in all, I find myself using the app less and less because using it is so unpleasant.

I’m getting ready to delete this game, even though I really like it. I would have given it 5 stars at first, but not any more. The problem is the tournaments. This is my favorite part of the game. I put in time and effort to climb the leaderboard, get 1st place, and advance to the next higher level of the tournament. But I cannot get past the Silver 1 level, even though I get first place. This has happened multiple times!! Let me paint a picture for you. This is what happened last night. I’m on the Silver 1 level, I work hard, use my coins and rubies, build a huge lead. I check on it a few minutes before the tournament is over, and see that my huge lead remains. Then I go to bed. This morning, I check on it. The game congratulates me on getting first place. I receive my prizes. I’m feeling good. Finally, I’m moving on to Gold levels! I click the tournament button to begin, and I see that I’ve been demoted to Silver 3. Why? The game told me I won!!!!! I’m so angry. I’m angry because I like the game, because I want the game to work properly. I’m angry because of all the wasted hours! There is either a glitch in the game, or there are not enough people playing it to have Gold levels and beyond. Either way, I’m upset, and I’m not going to waste any more time on this game.

100% a data collector disguised as a trivia app and here’s how I know. Reason #1. Before you can even start 1 trivia you have to agree to the privacy policy. I tried everything to get around it without luck. Within 5 seconds the prompt shows up and essentially locks the app until you hit agree. If you click the Privacy Policy and skim through it, you can see it’s heavily worded about your personal data collected. It will be shared / sold to 3rd parties and they might even reach out to other data collectors to collect more information about you. Don’t believe me? Go read it for yourself. Reason #2. Now onto the actually trivia. Here’s some actual questions verbatim. “What color is Shrek” ”Which movie is the snowman "Olaf" from?” “If you wanted to purchase sneakers, what brand would you look at?” “Which brand would sell you a car?” “Which company slogan is "Eat fresh"?” “Which brand would you choose if you were thirsty?” Reason #3. It looks like a regular Trivia app; however they are fishing to see what brands you are familiar with. They use your answers to start building your ad profile, and know how to better Target you with new brands. Why should you care? At the end of the day you should have the choice to say yes or no to being data collected and/or mined . With this app you aren’t given a choice to say “No I would not like my data to be collected and sold off to an ad company so they can target me with specific brands” Now if this isn’t a big deal for you and you want your data sold then 10/10 I recommend. If you care about privacy then Do not recommend -100/10 P.S. To the Devs. Next time you develop an app, maybe don’t hire a programmer from Wish. The app is clunky and looks like it was a made in 2011 . It’s 2022

This app is a scam. Firstly, you can only cash out a minimum of $5. That doesn’t sound too bad, but it’s ridiculous when you think about it. If you don’t make that $5 within a certain amount of time, you lose all your money. I used to play this game a couple of years ago and the most I ever had in my account was like $1. Not to mention that it used to be ever night, now it’s only once a week. This has so much opportunity to be a good game but they ruined it

Now it’s only once a week. This is a problem because, at the same time they drastically reduces players’ chances of winning (to once a week), they also now require a minimum of $5 to cash out. This doesn’t sound too bad, except you don’t get your money WHEN you win it. They hold your money until some arbitrary date that’s regularly 4-5 months later. Still, you could just wait and let the money accrue in your account right? Nope! Another little stipulation they added is that your money is taken back after 90 days. So if they don’t release $5 or more before those 90 days are up, you lose that money. So, since they hold your money as long as they please, they really never have to pay out. So it looks like people are winning, but after months of waiting they lose their winnings because HQ has set up a set of rules that really only benefits them and sneakily allows them to not issue the payouts as promised. I’m a long time player, since Birds’ Nest Soup days. I liked the company and thought the majority of their decisions were ethically in the right. This new development though? It wreaks of shady scammer app. Boo HQ. You’ve really managed to flush that success down the toilet. Good thing you get to keep all your money now.

This is a super simple version of those games with a totally unrelated, poorly rendered, highly ungrammatical prison escape story laid overtop of it. It also pushes hints on you whether you want them or not, so it’s not like you can even enjoy the elementary school level of the puzzles without letters shaking at you telling you which ones to pick. It’s pretty terrible on all possible fronts.

Game is entirely built around draining your wallet. Devs don’t even try to hide it. It’s a cash grab, and I recommend finding a different word game app for this and other reasons. The dictionary it uses will also not recognize proper nouns, unless it is an arbitrarily chosen proper noun for the level (such as a country name), as well as arbitrarily allowing certain standard English words because I guess they’re vulgar? But somehow proper medical vocabulary is vulgar, but not several other slang and hateful terms, some of which would generally be considered highly offensive and are without any other meanings. So in short, the dictionary is not only incomplete, it is completely arbitrary rather than using a standard boggle or scrabble word list.Shame on these devs and others like them that can’t make a game that is sold on its merits and has to resort to micro transaction currencies for revenue. Its no secret that this model only makes money because it targets a small percentage of players with addictions, so continuing to use this model in light of this well-known information is not just a cop-out, or bad for the game market, but actually evil.

Despite my frustrations with the game, it is addictive and fun. It can be challenging, especially when you are overlooking a word you know but just don’t “see” as an option. Overall, I do enjoy the game. To understand my frustrations, read on.My gripe with the game is that the dictionary in use (Wordnik) seems to fluctuate in consistency or in application from session to session (game board to game board).- If you accept the plural form of a word, then the singular should be acceptable, too. This has been the case for plural words that are defined as “the plural form of” the singular version of the word.- Personally, I don’t consider a suffix to be a word, but the game does at times, then doesn’t at others - for the exact same word.- The word “née” (as in maiden-name) was a word on a few boards/games. But the word isn’t allowed as a bonus word on other boards. This isn’t the case for either basic words or abstruse words that are consistently bonus words and/or on the game board, too.- If archaic words or words exclusive to specific fields of study are to be allowed, then that should be consistent. Some slang words seem to be accepted, but then a word still in use, though rare of formal in use, is excluded. Yet it is in the dictionary that the game uses (checked against web search using multiple dictionaries, including Wordnik. So, why isn’t the word allowed?- Using the “add a word” option to comment on words that aren’t accepted but should be, doesn’t seem to actually do anything, unless these aren’t added for multiple updates in a row.The lack of consistency is frustrating, especially as one of the aspects of the game is to aim to achieve continuous word entries (accepted words).

Edit: I’m knocking another star off this review because it’s been roughly a year since my last review and there have been no improvements made to voice recognition on the app. I have zero issues with voice recognition on the desktop app, but the mobile app’s voice recognition is HORRIBLY inconsistent at best. Certain phrases work first time, other phrases I can repeat 40 times and never pass, the same phrases that I have no issues with on the desktop. And it’s the Spanish course. I have to imagine it’s one of the most popular, if not the most popular, non-English Babbel course, and most everything else about the app is great. I keep trying out the app again every couple months looking for improvements, but the voice recognition is so unbelievably frustrating that I don’t even want to use the app. I will continue to use Duolingo until voice is fixed. I’ve got a 700 day streak to maintain there anyway. I definitely regret paying for this as is. ———————————————————————————Original: I love so many aspects of this app. I like the way the content is presented. I like the design and flow of the courses. And I like having the choice to pick speech, listening, etc. for review. The one major drawback to this app that I am shocked I’m not seeing in other reviews is the poor speech recognition in some of the lesson conversations. This is honestly infuriating to me sometimes. Speech recognition seems to work perfectly early in a lesson where it just gives you a phrase to repeat back and I never have problems with those. Then when it gets later in a lesson where there’s a conversation and you play one of the roles, the speech recognition becomes abysmal. Some of the same sentences or phrases that I had zero problems with early in the lesson will not work even after fifty tries. And it’s not like they’re extremely difficult phrases. One that I could not get to work was “Hola, Carmen, cómo estás?” I literally never got this one to work, and everyone knows this super basic Spanish pronunciation, but most of the phrases during the conversation portion will not work for me. I even had a native speaker try it and it didn’t work. I noticed sometimes if I drop off the first couple words that it will occasionally work, but that’s #1 just wrong, and #2 a complete guessing game. Now, if I fire up my computer and open Babbel in a web browser, I have no issues at all. So it seems to be an issue with the app. I thought it could possibly be my iPhone 11 Pro, so I tried again after upgrading to an iPhone 12 Pro and the issue is the same. My iPad also seems to have the same issue. This one issue consistently causes me to lose motivation to keep using Babbel. I hope that this issue is addressed in future updates because I really enjoy the other aspects of Babbel, but for now, I’ll just have to rely on Duolingo.

My family and I enjoyed Babbel at first, but as we progressed, the lessons became far too long, and with no way to save your work and come back later, we’ve been stuck sometimes up to 40-45 minutes trying to finish a lesson so that we don’t lose our work and have to start over. My recommendations: 1. Break up longer lessons into more manageable chunks to avoid student burn-out. 2. Develop a way to save work mid-lesson so students don’t lose progress if they run out of time. I am cancelling all subscriptions for my family for these reasons. If these issues are fixed, I would consider returning.

I briefly wish to commend TED Talks for having become a magnificent global forum for the exchange of ideas and ideals indispensable to humanity at this and all future stages of its profess and maturation.  The largest forward leaps in civilization on this planet have always been directly correlated with public information, education, illumination and inspiration.   TED Talks present an entirely contemporary means of providing that service to all by enlightening and stimulating the public sentiment, awareness and conviction by presenting individuals with the necessary access to factual realities, expert opinions, and seasoned wisdom in succinct, digested and digestible presentations of key points on the leading and most critical issues of the times.   As the inceptors and fashioners of the breakthrough documents that created and permitted modern democracy to exist, to progress and to thrive realized and emphatically proclaimed, the progress and stability of humanity is dependent on and the product of an informed and enlightened public.   Herein do we discover the preeminent value and serviceability of TED Talks in contributing to the ongoing provision of all these essentials to human survival, advancement and happiness.

I used to really enjoy this app back in 2018, when I used to own an android (if that info is relevant). I thought back to all those Ted Talks I used to listen to daily and decided to download the app on my iPhone 11 Pro.Firstly, I think the content in the recommendations page went way down. It also seems like the developers scaled down the home page and made the podcast section the main attraction.And even though the search bar reels up only 1-3 results at a time (which is a lot these days, because putting in a single word - like “happiness,” for example - brings up zero) I mostly hate that the thumbnails for the videos won’t show up anymore.I used to receive recommendations for great Ted Talks almost every week - from Graham Hill’s ‘Less Stuff, More Happiness,’ to practically anything from or similar to talks by Andrew Solomon.I do love that the download option is still free - but since the quality of content is so low on the app, I’ll be deleting it after my last few downloads and sticking to YouTube for better Ted talks.

So, there’s so much good about this game. I’m not super-competitive in it, and root for opponents to be creative and do well even if I prefer to win more often than losing, haha.However, the number of times I win when someone has a hilarious, better answer that isn’t accepted; or when the reverse is true; is very frustrating. Especially when you report the great answer as valid, and weeks or months later the great answer comes up again, and it still hasn’t been added to the database of valid answers... it’s lame, and takes a lot of the joy out of it, especially given the annoyingly insistent ad presence that otherwise would be tolerable.A paring knife is a tool. A blue jay is an animal. Ducklings are animals. Juluca is a medicine. Westport is a US city. These have been submitted multiple times. On and on and on. I know, I’m spending way too much effort *caring* about this... but that’s why I gave up and deleted the app.

This is a GREAT app for learning bass guitar. I absolutely love it. The instructors are great (I also took some guitar and piano in the app; a true plus is you can learn other instruments for the same price), and the opportunity to play with music tracks of various styles is awesome. With the bass, it’s particularly important to hear music behind you and to play along. I’ve literally had hours of enjoyment. For sheer joy of playing, I can’t recommend this app more. However, I did struggle to play outside the app. There’s no information about how bass players play along with or adapt chord charts; no info about scales or improvising with them (which is what bass players commonly do); no info or training at all on reading standard tab and applying it to a song. So while I LOVE playing with the app and the way it teaches instruments, I wish it would cover this other important info. I’d also love way more jazz tracks and less metal, in a perfect world. But you won’t regret the money you spend. I’ve never learned an instrument so fast in my life.

I loved the original game from way back in DS days.This version resembles it just enough to make you remember what you liked.  But you don’t get to do that game very often.Oh, and watch an ad!Make a meatloaf… stir it…watch an ad… then cook it.  Screw it up?  Use game coins or watch an ad.  Out of game coins? Watch an ad.Little pictures for other parts of the game — watch an ad.I want to do another recipe… oh, watch an ad.   How do you grow food, who knows… but maybe you should watch an ad.Next part of game watch an ad.  What did I do wrong?  Watch an ad.  A customer is here he wants me to watch an ad.What is happening next… I should watch an ad.Watch an ad.  Watch an ad.The screen is 85% prompts to try to get you to watch an ad, 10% new stuff, like growing a tree, and 5% what you wanted to play originally.   And don’t forget to watch an ad.

I downloaded this for the nostalgia (as most have). First thing is the actual recipe making is WAYYY easier. I don’t know if it’s because I’m not 10 and my hand-eye coordination is better, but it’s pretty impossible to mess up a recipe. Easy win there. Also, they’ve added like 20 different “extensions”. You can cook (the original point of the game), fish, grow crops, manage a supermarket, etc. In my opinion, it’s too much. There’s too much going on and I’m still trying to find the relevance of all the extras. They don’t seem to help you progress in the game it’s just a way to pass time. The ads are also a little annoying. You technically only have to watch a few but the option is ALWAYS there. Anything and everything you do an ad is available to speed up the process, or get more coins. All in all if you’re looking for the old game you played on your DS this isn’t it. Still kinda fun for when you’re bored

The recipes are pretty good too.My only problems with this game is that my device is really laggy, and I sometimes sort of ‘disconnect’. And you have to pay real life money to unlock certain recipes. I have had this app on my phone since i was in NINTH GRADE (age 14). i’m 24- going on 25 now & this is one of the only games/apps i keep on my phone. It’s low stress/anxiety and very calming after a long, crazy day. The recipe packs are super cheap to the point i own every single one. There’s so many recipes to earn/buy that I still haven’t made every recipe, let alone master them all. Not sure what people are talking about when they mention ads? I get one maybe every 30 mins - sometimes i go longer without seeing one. The other ones you can watch to earn coins, which i earn through recipes, the restaurant, the farm, etc. There’s so much to do in one game. Not to mention the major nostalgia value. I don’t know - I guess I don’t understand why everyone’s so butthurt when i’ve been playing this game for at least 15 years and have nooo issue with this version. I feel like y’all are just mad you have to pay for the recipes now instead of earning all of them. It’s an app - like *most* apps, there’s a paywall for certain things. Quit whining. Side note for the game developers: i would absolutely LOVE some new recipe packs soon! I know they take time to roll out though, so i’ll be patient!

Hello! Thank you for looking at this review. Here is my opinion of the game. I think it’s a very fun game! I have always been into cooking and I personally think that this game could help with cooking. I’m 10 years old now, but I still like to cook. The app doesn’t have that many adds which is very relieving. Almost all the games I have have at least 2 adds per minute. But cooking mama has 2 adds per every 10 minutes basically. That makes me so happy and gives me more time to actually play and enjoy the game. I also really like all the dishes you can make. There is so many to choose from! My personal favorite is the sushi balls. Their really fun to make! I also like how’s it gives you some help, and is not hard. Another feature I like is that you have your own little restaurant and you can sell the food you make. I also like that when you finish making your dish, you always get rewarded with $20 or $10 (money from the game). There is just one problem. I actually prefer the old cooking mama then this big new update. The update isn’t much different from what it was a couple years ago but they made some weird changes. I thought you earn the dishes, but when I started playing for the first time after a couple years I had so many new dishes that I haven’t cooked yet. That part really bugged me. But other then that the game is fantastic! Definitely recommended.                                                    -XOXO

I have just read some of the responses from the app’s developers, who are part of Wikipedia.org. They are as dismissive, critical, snarky, and of a similar tone to comments by Wikipedia overseers. The contempt of the developers is particularly telling when they leave condescending responses to reviews that aren’t about the app but rather about Wikipedia itself. Yet are interestingly silent when it comes to reviews with valid criticisms of the app. (Perhaps there ought to be an article on self-help for the developers’ egos, or for one particular developer, is needed). Regardless whether the app developers are employees or volunteers, I’d think any time and effort of the “small team” would be more effectively spent on responding to valid app reviews, and on improving the app.Be a grown up and leave your easily offended ego someplace else I was going to say “at home.” Upon thinking about the implications of this, however, I realized leaving easily offended egos at home is NOT an acceptable place to leave them. In fact, there is NO place where easily offended egos belong.

I usually delete any app with this many bugs, but I have to use it for grad school. Why it's buggy: Too often when I re-open it (because you can't stay logged in, as others have noted), it either freezes or gives me a false error message. Once open, it's slow to update; 5 minutes can pass before new grades or other additions show up. And Discussion threads often fail to load, or it won't load my posts after I submit them. All of this is troublesome because "try again later" is not an option when you're on deadline.Why it's balky:The app doesn't allow split screen, one of the iPad's most useful features. The "Activity Stream" is pointless yet remains the mandatory default open page, while too many clicks are required to get to a page one actually cares about (and repeatedly visits). When writing a reply in Discussions, it's impossible to see the original post one is replying to. Pasting text into Discussion posts (unless in plain text?) eliminates kind-of-important elements like apostrophes. There's no way to tailor notifications. There's no way to modify and correct "overdue" notifications for assignments that aren't necessary or were turned in late. What's needed:Less freezing and faster uploads. More tailoring options, including a "Favorites" list. More control over notifications. A neater Discussion interface.

You may have been wondering what the difference is between Overdrive, Libby, and Sora.  In this review I’ll explain that.Overdrive: Overdrive is the original.  Overdrive is the classic one that I was used to and I used first.  It is basically a place where you can check out ebooks and audiobooks from your local library.Libby: Libby is the new, updated version of Overdrive.  It is a place where you can check out ebooks and audiobooks from your local library, and it differs from Overdrive because it is simply the newer version.Sora: Sora is very similar to Libby, but for school.  It is a place where you can check out ebooks and audiobooks from your school library and your local library.  You have to use your school library for Sora, but you can also add your local library.Overall: Overall, Overdrive is the old one, so unless it’s the only one available to you, I wouldn’t recommend using Overdrive.  Now it’s just between Libby, and Sora, and which one you should choose really depends on you and your needs.  If you are a adult and have graduated school, use Libby.  If you are a student who likes getting ebooks from your school but also have a personal library account, I would recommend Sora.  With Sora you not only get access to ebooks from your school library, you also get ebooks from your personal local library account smushed into the same app!  It’s a great combination, and I would recommend Sora for a student.  So that’s my answer: use Overdrive if you have to, use Libby if you’ve graduated school, and use Sora if you have a school library account and/or a personal library account.And back to Sora, since this review is about Sora: I love how school and personal are smushed together into one very useful app.  Four star rating.

I was asking homework questions and I guess the honor code team noticed that I was asking one too many within one day and sent me a “final warning” saying that if I don’t stop asking questions and using them towards my homework, then my account will be terminated permanently.  The one that sent me the email was named Amy Smith and the email subject was titled “Re: Chegg.com - Honor code violation - notice and finale warning.”  I never got a first warning or a notice.  This isn’t considered cheating if I use the questions I ask experts on homework, it’s through MyMathLab so it’s all generally automatic questions for each one.
The answers are very detailed but at times I cannot understand the handwriting
This program helps me out a lot on my homework.

I’ve been using this for a few months  and it seems like every time I post a question I need to contact support. I posted a question earlier and all I got was a spam answer which was a waste of my time and a question that I pay for. When I messaged support at first they just gave me a scripted answer that didn’t even answer the question I asked. I had to keep telling them the problem until they gave me my question back and just told me to post the question again. When I asked what to do if it happened again they just said to follow the question guide for posting. (So helpful) Their customer service is lacking and how they handle question posts most of the time is just sad. For each question you post you only get 1 answer and sometimes it doesn’t even answer the question. Even if you say it wasn’t an answer to the question they won’t send a new “Expert” to re answer your question which is stupid. That’s a huge flaw for them in my opinion. Other than this I feel that Chegg is only good for finding already answered questions.
Not all answers are correct

First of all, I use the app on my phone as I don’t have a tablet. Second, it would be WONDERFUL if, when I go onto the desktop site I could ACTUALLY SIGN IN. Which about 75% of the time it says there’s an error. FIX THIS or my money’s gone and I’ll pay for course hero or brainly.

This app replaced the old Flashcard app. It was supposed to bring all my flashcards over, but half are gone. That’s a lot of work lost. And they locked access to the old app. Why? Not supporting it is fine, but don’t lock users out. Not cool.

When the app is working properly, it works wonders which is why they got stars at all. I am constantly being logged out of my account and restricted from it over bogus claims. “Uh oh this account has been restricted due to an unusual amount of activity.” OBVIOUSLY I’M USING WHAT I PAID FOR. I cannot wait until May to cancel this account and never get charged for something that questions me EVERY TIME I use it. So frustrating. I am only using one device & never let others use my account. I am doing my part and paying $20 monthly to use this app yet Chegg can’t get it together enough for me to actually use what I pay for!!!! Stop logging me out, making me change my passwords, verify devices, etc. IT’S STILL ME. Sincerely, a frustrated college student.

Sure, Chegg might help you get some answers right, if you can even use your account. They make you pay to use Chegg, and yet somehow more than half the time I can’t even get into my account because of “errors” or “failing to authenticate.” I’ve changed my password several times. I’ve linked my google to it. I don’t ever log out and yet I’m always struggling to get back into my account. The “verification” they make you do to prove you aren’t a robot doesn’t work half the time, either. In my opinion, Chegg is overall a scam to get you to pay and then make it as difficult as possible for you to use your account. $15 and for what? I will be cancelling my subscription and never using Chegg again, and I would suggest sticking to Quizlet or Course Hero instead. Anything but Chegg.

Cons -It has a limit of only 2 device which is completely ironic , keeping in mind I’m the one paying for the app and should be able to use as many device as I’d like to … this can be a hassle while in a timed assignment because you then have to try to swap it out which is almost not possible . -Almost every time that I sign in, it ask for a verification code that’s sent via email ,which has become very annoying -After canceling you can still be charged, I’ve canceled my account before and still received charges for an entire summer break and even my previous semester of 2021, which means this is an ongoing problem and it hasn’t been fixed, however, I was able to get a refund/ dispute my charges when I wasn’t able to get a resolution from their  customer service team -Pros, you can get help with difficult classes for instance maths , physic , bio and Chem however I would suggest not using it to get help for essay writings, writing aren’t authentic and usually copied  from somewhere which can result in plagiarism .

This app is very clearly designed to make it as difficult as possible for you to cancel or pause your subscription. There is no option to do so at all in the app, and when it redirects you to their webpage to cancel your subscription, it will give you a mysterious error message telling you that something went wrong. Only if you log in through a regular link will it even allow you to successfully do so. Overall this is a shady and greedy app. Don’t waste your time.

Wonderful app to learn Spanish. Reasonable premium pricing.  Well organized with extensive vocabulary, verb and grammar training.
The app is great, giving translations and words in context to help me chose the right word.  I love it.
I wasn’t able to use your app in Cuba. Very frustrating. I used google translate instead.
I’ve been using SpanishDict for years to augment my continued learning of Spanish. I love the product. Keep up the great work!

I love this app because it offers you 3 choices of translations, and the ease in which you can look up the meaning of a word, and examples of its common usages.  I wish it had more space to type a short paragraph, as I use it frequently for conversation via text messages.  This App is more accurate in Spanish (Mexico) to English translation than Google Translate (GT).  I have caught many embarrassing mistakes on GT by double-checking on this App.  One time using GT, I almost asked my gardener to marry me.  Luckily, I knew the translation didn’t look right and double checked here.  Ever since then, I say “when in doubt, check it out!”

I really love this Spanish translator app. I am learning Spanish, and it is incredibly helpful. It does more than just translate. It also shows you conjugations, grammar, context, tenses etc. When you search a word, it tells you how to use it, and in which contexts it is applicable. It also shows you many different words with similar meanings so you can find just what your looking for. It even tells you what words mean regionally. It’s amazing!!! Definitely recommend!!!
Easy to use
I’ve been using SpanishDict for the past six years since I began my study of Spanish. It is Excellent!

So much better than the last time I used this app. They updated the interface so it is much more accessible and less laggy to use and not too mention way more responsive. There are ads but they only last 5 seconds and don’t take away from the experience.
Terrific app.
this app has everything you need of your learning or planning on learning the correct words and terms in Spanish, highly recommend.

This is, by far, one of the best apps I’ve used in my life in general, but more specifically it is a fantastic dictionary that informs better than others, simply because they have example sentences that finish the work that definitions and translations can’t by themselves. Seeing a word in context is the greatest strength of this app. The picture of the day of different places in the Hispano sphere are all beautiful and the word of the day is always an off-the-beaten path choice compared to other word of the days that I have followed. And they are often seasonally relevant, too. And finally, it has a very informative grammar section which again, illustrates well through examples. It is my first go-to for anything I want to know about Spanish. I use it almost daily
I am a beginner in Spanish and for me the words are not very useful. They are better for intermediate students

I mostly use this to look up words & practice vocab lists for school. I used to have to write every word on the list in here from Quizlet and so I was so happy when I found the import feature. Now I’ve gotten all entitled with it and see improvements to their vocab list feature that y’all can pls consider  Also viva la voice review btw so good, lets me turn menial tasks into review time & study more. Ok so: *Please add import feature on phone. *Please let us choose the accent of the prompts. A British person saying a word often makes me think it’s a different one. *I even have trouble understanding the word the American speakers say sometimes, that’s another thing. Maybe add something like “verb, noun, etc” Bc it happens so often where my time is wasted Bc it’s hard to understand what they want ie: “Well” “La fuente” “no, Pues” *The pics do help to provide context but the whole point of voice review is to not look at your phone & for it to be hands free (oh btw y’all’s picture for “church” is the Latter Day Saint San Diego temple, but no complaints, it’s good to see! Y’all are sharing it with so many yas!! Hahaha) *So this is a problem in-school Spanish in general: the course material is very formal and unrealistic and has you talking like the old people who write textbooks. To add to the problem my teacher is really finnicky & insists that her words are the right words & if we don’t use them we’re cheating. So can you make it easier to change the translations of words, for example: Escaparate: Real life: a window Spanish according to my teacher: window shopping I know that seems like a small difference, but when your teacher doesn’t do partial credit on tests, one wrong letter on a translation can make you fail a whole test.   So please let us easily change words without having to delete them & re add them to the list so we’re not learning the wrong translation for class without knowing it. It’s hard to keep track of “class words” and “real life words” and they shouldn’t be different but...c’est la vie I guess *You know how on the homepage you can click “vocab quiz” and it quizzes your whole list? Super cool! Could you make a “priority list” feature tho for the app homepage so I can, for example, practice my brand new list from school *Pls have the grammar lessons on the phone they are so good & helpful!! And finally just a life idea I saw that someone on your team is into Portuguese and lollll that’s actually kinda what sparked me to learn it like “you can do both yay” so a Portuguese version of SpanishDict would be TOP! Y’all made ingles.com so... Ik that’s a huge project. But like if y’all got time burning a whole in your pocket ... Viva Brazil!  Ok and that’s all thank y’all so much! Best Spanish app and uh if y’all could change your name so it doesn’t sound like the d word that would also be awesome so!!!
It’s a great help for you me when I’m studying with Duolingo
I wish you guys could add some more things to the dictionary,like idioms and expressions,over all great job,I love it…!!!

I have my TV connected to my computer and can access every other streaming service just fine via web browser or desktop application, but Noggin only offers a separate $8 subscription to their “Amazon Prime Video Channel” which you would think would be included with this subscription, but it’s not. I digress, the advertising is misleading or at the very least not clear. Most would expect normal streaming services with such an expensive monthly fee.

The iOS version just displays a bunch of shows in a linear order with no particular set order interspersed with random music videos. At least the Fire TV version has it arranged by seasons so you can consistently figure out how to find the next episodes instead of constantly scrolling until you find the episodes you want. Overall I’ve found the Apple TV version of Noggin to be awful after using it on a Fire TV. Their Apple TV developers need to try a lot harder.

I very much enjoy this game. I do a full set of five every night. It stays fairly challenging (usually), and has a good balance of common and esoteric knowledge. Easy to play free. Ads aren’t too bad, rewards are great for just playing a bit and keeping a streak. Even the cost of playing without ads isn’t prohibitive. In terms of problems, the only thing keeping it from five stars is the unpredictability of what letters will fill in what. If I know four of five answers, it isn’t fun to have all of those basically fill in, but to have no letters to help in another word. Also… so many questions about fish and marine life, guys (especially sea slugs for some reason). Again, I appreciate esoterica, but i feel like there is a fish clue in every other puzzle.

Great, hard game with lots of good vocabulary and minimal adsDefinitely geared towards older adults with the longer words and older pop culture references. Would not recommend for kids who are too young to search these references. Biggest irk playing this game is the changing of word tense. The questions are always in singular present tense so the endings should match. It’s harder to guess a word when it randomly changes to past tense (ed) or plural (s or es).

Enjoyable, challenging and fun, but I despise constant ads. There only seems to be one option for purchase, which is $9.99 a month. There are a number of equally fun games that are a one-time payment.
“Invite your friends” For each friend that joins the game through the link you get 20 tokens! That's a lie, I added my brother through a link I watched him download and play I didn't get 20 tokens.

I use this app across my devices! I have many saved playlists and beats ready for practice at any time. I use the Practice Mode feature often, which increases the tempo automatically and builds speed and accuracy. I also use the various tones for the beat, including a voice counting tone which is great.The stage mode which switches to the next beat automatically when performing different beats in a practice is also great!Sadly, the playlist and beats do not sync across the devices which is very annoying and a let down for a cross platform app which I have paid for in the pro version. A Mac OS version would be great to build complex beats and rhythms for practice. Another feature to improve would be the subdivisions. The smallest resolution is 16 beats of 32 note lengths. It would be great to have 32 beats for 32 note lengths for intricate melody line rhythm training. Otherwise, very happy with the app! The best metronome app by far.

If there was some way this platform could incorporate that, that would make this app the BEST! The “Skills” resource is extremely valuable. Pretty sure they’re deleting reviews but here goes. Ultimate Guitar used to be the best resource for novice to expert guitar players if you were looking for chords or tabs, especially since they began forcing other free to use tab sites out. That was when they only had the website. Fast forward to today and the app is the least intuitive dumpster fire of an app I’ve ever used. What’s worse is that whether you have it downloaded or not using the site in your browser forces you to use this sorry excuse for an app in order to get at the information you want or you’ll be forced to scroll around prompts you can’t close and a site that’s basically setup to direct you to using what they want you to use. When I posted this review initially, UG commented on it to tell me I was wrong without addressing any issues I mentioned. Best off checking it out for yourself, then do yourself a favor and switch to Songsterr. It’s everything UG wishes it was. It’s so much better I gladly began paying the $5 monthly membership instead of suffering through using UG for free.

Worth every. Single. Dollar. I've been playing guitar for 20 years - I love having all my favorite songs at my finger tips. It's really a game changer. Don't know what I would do without it!

While yes this is a hassle, it definitely wouldn’t make me stop using the app. However it also no longer scrolls when I’m in a song. Not just the auto-scroll feature but at all. I’m giving 2 stars because it was useful in the past. Will likely let my subscription go because of this. My advice (at this point) would be DON’T SUBSCRIBE. I loved this game. I even played it when it first came out and picked it up here and there.I backed up my account before I deleted it, and came back to it a year later. Absolutely nothing was left.When you first log into the game, you’re hit with a “SUBSCRIBE” poster, even if you have the subscription.Then you’re given a ton of offers to purchase this or that, or whatever else.Now you don’t need to buy these to have fun in the game. It’s a fine game by itself.But I figured I would drop around $15 on the game, since I had gotten about 20 or so hours out of it.When I log in, all I see is all the things I had bought GONE. Lost hours worth of progress.Emailed them with no response. I just refunded my items and will be deleting the app.What happened to free rewards? What happened to the good app I used to play?They want your money, that is all. They don’t care if you like the app or not.

So this app is so stressful and horribly designed, I asked my whole Math Period and everyone agrees this app causes nothing more than pain and staying up for hours to finish these things and even sometimes we don't even finish them. This is the kind of app made by someone who wants nothing more than children and teens to suffer the amount of tears and mental/ emotional damage. The damage this app causes is honestly Impressive.So lets get into the reason behind why I call this app a waste of time and space,The point system is Horrible you get to a 80 one miss click leads to 75 and then it goes into a spiral and then your at 45 and the little explanations the app tries to give you to “explain how you got it wrong” never helps. This all leads to what I like to call “the 3 steps of IXL.” Step 1 Frustration the student starts getting slightly frustrated with the work but they keep working.Step 2 denial they start to believe they have the right answer even if its completely wrong and they start disagreeing with the app if it says their wrong.Step 3 infuriation This step is when tears and broken computers come into play, after all that effort, all that time the student has reached a High score and is almost done and then it all comes crashing down the student does 1 of 3 things they start going into a frenzy of rage and start rapidly answering questions mostly guessing which leads them to giving up and closing their computers, or they give up right away crying about it before closing their computer,and finally they go into a real fit of rage and destroy their device.

Updated Review:  I’ve been a long time player of 7 Little Words, purchased many packs and endured a number of redesigns.  A recent one, unfortunately eliminated the unlimited hints option for many of us.  After two days of email discussion with the developers, they found a bug in the program, which they addressed in the most recent update.  The folks I dealt with were helpful, professional and addressed my concerns in a timely and courteous manner.  Other companies could learn from the BlueOx team.  Well done!*****Original Review:  Not only have the developers put out a simply terrible update, but they have removed the unlimited hints option that I PURCHASED years ago. It’s like paying for a car in cash and having the dealership come to you 10 years later and say you no longer have access to the steering wheel unless you fork up more money. So disappointing!

This app overall is nice, but I agree with another reviewer regarding the story of Abraham and Isaac. I just began using this app with my 5 year old and this lesson was only the third story he chose to watch. After having just told me, “This teaches good stuff” he heard the narrator say that Abraham was going to kill his son, and he looked at me in horror. I understand some truths in the Bible are unpleasant. Being an app for children I find this depiction (including images of Abraham holding a knife and Isaac lying on an alter tied up) to be inappropriate and frightening. I use the adult version of this app and thought this would be a safe and fun way to introduce my son to bible lessons, but now I’m afraid to let him watch more.

As a student this is organized when a child works in their own account. However, as a parent resource, this app is incredibly frustrating and unorganized if you have more than one child. The posts are added by your children’s teacher and isn’t sorted by student. This makes everything a constant mixed social feed and makes you spend more time trying to find resources and feeds, vs. actually pulling up the per child activities. Significant improvements could be made in this app for parent use.

This is. User experience nightmare. Unread message and notification icons don’t reset or change numbers when you read messages. Neither us or the kid can respond to or like posts that other student can due to a mystery bug so the kid can’t participate in the projects. Her only options are to generate a QR code which my 7 year old needs ...why??? Videos say “object not found” or “this video isn’t ready to play”. Messages appear on a different feed than notifications -why not just give them different icon or color? Getting to messages I have to click class announcements to even see them (why are we reinventing the concept of inbox?). Worst, for the life of me, I can’t understand why I need a class app AND a family app with the same username/password that show some of the same posts but responding to the feed of one doesn’t show up in the other.  Don’t even get me started on the discombobulated registration/approval process. It’s also not paperless; every project here I need to send to my printer and this must go through texting myself because this app can’t send anything to print. As a UX/UI designer with 17 years experience -I hope this gets fixed or disappears along with that darn coronavirus.

As a busy mom, I am so grateful for the Homer app! My daughter asks to have iPad time for Homer specifically. Before school let out, I was given a list of areas that my Naomi needed to work on prior to school starting in the fall as determined by her teachers. Homer actually gave a quick pre- assessment questionnaire  in order to make a targeted learning path for her— I was so pleased to see that the path they created for her was exactly what her teachers said she needed to practice. There is a good mix of engaging reading and writing practice and Naomi is able to navigate with little to no help from me. Her brother (8) actually likes to do the work with her sometimes, laughing alongside her to the funny stories and cheering her on when she does the practices correctly. As a teacher and mother, I highly recommend!

Homer charges a subscription about as much as Netflix with only the smallest fraction of content Netflix offers. Most of the content is just curated from other sources, basically the same as just creating bookmarks in your browser when you find a good video on YouTube. As an educator, I find a lot their custom content to be highly questionable in execution. Like many similar apps, they favor “engagement” over sound learning strategy, so that a child left alone with the tablet could just keep clicking buttons, even while they’re being distracted and confused by what the focus of the learning is. My opinion is that this method would slow or derail a child’s comprehension rather than reinforcing or expediting it. On technical level, there are a number of crashes and glitches we’ve experienced though it functions well most of the time. It’s VERY frustrating that you need to be online to use all content. They charge $10 a month and don’t even have an offline feature for trips or time away from WiFi. Disappointing to say the least.
