During the last year we were all sick on quarantine, and in desperation gave my under two toddler an iPad with homer on it to buy us a bit more time to sleep. She loves it. But more than that, the next week she climbed onto my lap and accurately identified a quarter of the letters on my laptop we had not been working with her on them at all previously, so she had to have learned from the app. Now several months later, she knows all her letters, including some lower case. She can identify numbers too, and can accurately count objects in groups. Homer really helped our inquisitive baby get a head start on learning!

My kids love the homer app. My 2 year old loves the stories and my 5 year old loves the reading. However with the last 2 updates it freezes once they try to play a level and then returns to home. I hope you guys will fix this so they can continue enjoying the app!

This app is such a waste of money. We couldn’t sign in and it kept telling us that we didn’t have an account. I was over it at that point and wanted to cancel. When I tried to cancel it was IMPOSSIBLE to do so. Very confusing and I had to contact costumer service just to cancel the subscription. Spend your money somewhere else because this is not worth it.

I have both my young children using this app and they are not only finding age appropriate games that they love, but they are learning tons while doing it! I love seeing my children learn through play! And I especially love that it is guilt free screen time :-)
I love using Homer! It has such interactive interface and engaging characters!!
i tried to put the birthdate in and it was locked to over May 9 2009, couldnt even go lower… bad app to start off
this app is amazing!! my kid is engaged and learning more everyday!!
App was great until it stopped working. Paid the annual fee and no support response to cancel and get money back.
We are sad this app no longer works on our older iPad. It also doesn’t work on our Amazon Fire tablet, so we had to cancel our subscription. My daughter enjoyed it, we are bummed.
Our two year old loves this app! He started playing it when he was 18 months old. It’s helped him recognize shapes, colors, letters, and numbers.
I got this specifically for reading and it’s not working, just like the review below states.

This is an incredible app. But. When you’ve paid sixty bucks for something, I at least want it to work when needed. Maybe it’s just down for today, but when we try to do the Reading Pathway, it just keeps saying something went wrong. Tried on other devices. Tried deleting and reinstalling. I would at least appreciate being able to ask the company WHAT is going on and how can we troubleshoot. Instead, there’s absolutely no support. And if there is, it certainly isn’t on display for me to easily find. Been a great app. Kids learn from it but I guess leaving this review is the only way I can communicate with the company.

The app itself is ok. The problem is trying to cancel when you no longer need the app. I have emailed several times to cancel our subscription with no luck. Aggravating that the $7.95 keeps withdrawing monthly.
If it's not a free app, don't list it as free. It's misleading and a waste of my time. Consider a "lite" version, but it should NOT say "free".

This app doesn’t work. It continuously makes us log in and then says it can’t find my information. My kids haven’t been able to use this app since I purchased it. I’ve reached out to the company a dozen times and they just don’t respond. WASTE OF MONEY, do not recommend.

Can someone help me cancel my subscription, it shouldn’t be this difficult and it kind of seems purposeful to trap people into it. Rather it works or not if I don’t want to pay for it anymore I shouldn’t have to just through a bunch of hoops to cancel it.

I like the reading and math portion but there are too many videos in the music and book sections that distract child from focusing on the learning portion. If there was an option to limit the content I would give it five stars. As it is, I’m inclined to cancel the trial and delete app.

There is a complete lack of diversity. There’s plenty of “majority” representation, but very little for any marginalized groups. There are significantly more talking animals than people of color and the general “holiday” section is almost completely US based or Christian holidays. Only 2 holiday videos show any diversity, for hanukkah, but it’s clear watching them that they were written by a person who has never celebrated the holiday themselves. I emailed the customer service team and was told they’re “still working” on their commitment to diversity. Still working?? This app was released in 2013, if they haven’t figured out by now how to honor that “commitment” they aren’t even trying. I also asked if there was a way to opt out of the religious content, since it’s only focused on one religion, and was told no. We cancelled because I don’t give money to companies who only pretend to care about diversity and inclusion.
Applied for a 3 months trial and got confirmation but cannot use since the 4th day, just keep asking me to purchase it.

It’s extremely slow moving and repetitive. My son gets bored as it never seems to progress. I’m guessing all the levels in each subject need to be completed before anything can move on? He’s far too advanced for any of the extremely basic math or shapes but it won’t give us new lessons. Reading is at his level but spends far too long on the same topic/lesson to the point of frustration out of boredom. Can there not be different levels per topic? Or an option for a parent to speed ahead in certain areas?

We didn’t like this. We’d get to one spot and the microphone setting didn’t work and it never let us skip forward. Very complicated to navigate for me, can’t imagine what it’s like for my daughter. If it wasn’t for getting stuck on that one part I think it would’ve been fine. But so far I’m still on the hunt for a decent reading program!!

“Which triangle is red?” for 30 minutes?The lessons are extremely too long and frustrating. My kid ALREADY knows colors and shapes and letters uppercase and lowercase. I completed the protest of what my kid knows and is okay with - then was put with “which triangle is red?” for an entire 30 minutes. Needless to say, my kid got frustrated and screamed at the iPad “I already told you which triangle is red!!!! Ugh! This is so frustrating!!” Yeah. No go. And certainly don’t need to pay anyone $10/month to make my kid get frustrated. No thank you!!!!
Thanks homerIt is a nice appGood for learning

Great variety of activities and my kid actually enjoys it. He’s in the pre-reader stage and while the activities are easy for him to complete, they are very purposeful and keep him moving along. For instance, breaking down a word into 2 parts (I.e. app says ta-ble and he has to pick the picture of the table) to get him used to sounding words out. So far, so good. The app itself is smooth. No glitches so far and it doesn’t take forever to load.

The app is working well now thankfully!!Overall my kids love the app. I do wish there were less distractions. My 3 year old will be on a lesson where she is supposed to pick the letter “M” for example, but she can click on the cat that meows or makes a noise and she will press it over and over and not do the work. I also don’t love the way the “am” and “an” sounds are taught. They aren’t teaching how Americans pronounce them. It actually sounds British. It is a short a sound but when next to an m or n it’s slightly different.
There’s nothing free about this app. Once you download it, you’re asked some questions about your kid, and then you have to sign up for a subscription.

I have taught 4 of my 5 children how to read. My youngest had not picked up on it very quickly. By Christmastime, she still did not know her ABC’s well, and was not doing well with reading. I was unsure of what to do next, but knew something different needed to be done. I decided to try Homer. It has been the best thing we have ever done to help our youngest in her early education. After using Homer for 2 months, my daughter can confidently say and write the alphabet in order. She can also read many sight words and sound out many others. She is not only learning so much from this app, but she loves doing it. Even at night she wants to do her “school”. Homer has been such a God-send to us.
App has stopped opening and just gets stuck on the loading screen (spinning dot circle.) Unusable; cancelling subscription

Okay, I love the app for its actual content. My 4 year old is making great strides in reading, however we’ve been using consistently for a few months and have yet to be able to get through a 15 minute session without the app glitching. So frustrating for a quite expensive program.

this app helped me so much during my pregnancy i highly recommend told me everything i had questions about !! 10/10 :)

What a great resource this app was during my pregnancy.With the up-to-date information regarding what I should be feeling during, what the baby should look like month-to-month, and a calendar so I could follow along. I am amazed at how great this app is for being no cost.

Way to manny adds pop up when I try to get the kick counter or the contraction timer so I miss the times I paid extra to get those I don’t want adds ruining it I wish I could give this app zero stars cus this app is just terrible like u should have adds with the version u don’t pay for not the one u paid for it’s so stupid

My husband and I were trying to conceive for 6.5 years and when we got pregnant after our first medicated cycle we were very nervous. I downloaded a bunch of apps like the baby center and the glow apps and they were great but they both had communities which is usually great but for me only increased my anxiety. People posted about their early or second trimester losses and though they have every right to be talked about and need to be it made me so scared and not able to enjoy my pregnancy at all. I deleted those apps and downloaded this one after reading reviews and I am so thankful and impressed with it. It is much better than the other apps in general and doesn’t have the communities. It’s helped my anxiety ten fold!
One minute it works on my phone. Then the next, it doesn’t want to anymore. It keeps shorting out on my phone every time I try to open up the app. This new update is horrible.
This app is amazing. Shows everything you need to know and more.

I LOVE THIS APP!! I stay on it morning, noon and night! Full of wonderful information as well

I wrote it down and put it in my photos by taking a screen shot of the email and password when I made them. I even tried to reset my password but nothing worked. This has really upset me. This app is very useful the images are wonderful and details are great. The options it gives help you feel more organized and prepared. Which I feel like I e lost all this when I put trust in the app and it’s now gone. :(
I’m on the app 24/7 , so much good information about your little one . Definitely recommend

This is my favorite pregnancy app and I’ve used it for all three of my pregnancies! The articles about how my baby is growing and what’s happening to my body that specific week is my favorite part and has been very accurate for me personally. When I was 9 weeks pregnant with my third, I started feeling really hormonal and nauseous…I opened up the app and it literally said that this week I might feel more nauseous and hormonal than before! It then went on to share different ways I could help nauseous etc. This type of thing has happened multiple times on this app and I love that! I feel like it knows me haha. It’s filled with the kind of information I want during pregnancy. It’s also easy to use. I’ve recommended this app to all my pregnant friends

The amount of info this app gathers is far to intrusive. Please tone down the sensitive data you gather, I do not do business with companies that violate my privacy... sadly the list of companies who don’t is shrinking. That’s why it’s up to the consumer to avoid said companies.

I conceived on April 30, 2021. According to the app today I should be 8 weeks pregnant. I’m not. I’m only 6 weeks pregnant. We booked our dr appt. for today thinking I was 8 weeks pregnant. Our dr was very concerned with the size of our baby and schedule an ultrasound a week from now as he is concerned it is not growing correctly. He asks us when we think we conceived. I tell him. He responds “okay so 6 weeks.” I felt so dumb I had to open the app and show him where I was getting 8 weeks from! So embarrassing and scary since we all thought something must be seriously wrong. Otherwise, I have no problems with the app and appreciate the features.
I absolutely love this app. Especially the kick counter.

Not impressed. The app has out dated information especially with Covid being around for over a year now. The contraction counter is not worth it. It deletes your timings and there are plenty of other great contraction apps out there that beat this by a mile. The kick counter is handy but I’ve found 4 or 5 other apps that out do this one by far.

but there’s one thing i’d like to know how to do, how do i change my amount of weeks i’m on? i went to the doctor recently and i’m actually more ahead than i thought i was. i’ve tried looking everywhere on the app but i can’t find where to change it. other than that i love this app! it’s very helpful with keeping track of everything. thank you!
It won’t let me purchase a premium membership due to my location! I would love to be able to read the articles.
I really love this app cause right now I’m pregnant with my second child and I used this app the first time I was pregnant and I absolutely loved it and I like how it has name ideas

I’ve used this app for more than one pregnancy now it’s better than ever. It’s the best pregnancy app out there. I look forward to reading it everyday.

Looks like a great app but the layout is very hard to understand. Especially the timeline it would be easier if it’s in a monthly layout. It would be easier if it was in a calendar mode. Also is there a way we can add babies weight if wr know it?

I was excited when this app popped up because I used it with my first pregnancy with my son, and couldn’t wait to use it again. When I logged in, it kept saying my due date was out of bounds (because my son was born in 2018). When I tried to change the information to have a new due date, the app said that I would have to create a new Phillips account. So I tried to do that, only to be told that 2 accounts with the same email can’t exist. I do not have and do not want a second email. I’ve used several apps for both pregnancies so far and all of the other ones let me add a new pregnancy to an existing account. This app is super interactive and simple to use. The features allow you to basically track your pregnancy in real time week by week. The articles are also great and useful.
